title: tromp
author: tromp
created_time: November 01, 2022, 04:28:20 PMLast edit: November 02, 2022, 08:17:18 AM by tromp
content: I propose that an altruistic coin is one whose emission doesn't favor its creators or early adopters.It should favor the late adopters.One such emission is the simplest one possible: one coin per second, forever.This is trivially implemented by having a fixed block reward (subsidy) equal to the block interval in seconds.Altruistic coins avoid wealth concentration and deter speculation, while encouraging use as a currency.After several decades of wide distribution, they have inflation rates comparable to fiat, but unlike fiat,this rate remains perfectly predictable and ever-decreasing.There should be more altruistic coins...

comments.author: GreatArkansas
comments.body: Quote from: tromp on November 01, 2022, 04:28:20 PMI propose that an altruistic coin is one whose emission doesn't favor its creators or early adopters.It should favor the late adopters.(....)I don't find any difference here. Altcoin as an Alternative Coin is ok for me because it that becomes common among all of the people in the cryptocurrency market. And even if we will say there will be a change of name but they are still have the same function, no sense at all in changing it.Even me, I can consider me as not early adopters but hearing and being involved with "altcoins", I don't find any issue about its name.

comments.body: Propose theis to the biggest altcoins developer names in the community.And by doing that, you will be having a bigger voice that will reach those that may have the same thoughts as you. comments.author: Silberman
comments.body: Quote from: tromp on November 01, 2022, 04:28:20 PMWhat if we take alt-coin to mean altruistic-coin rather than alternative-coin?I propose that an altruistic coin is one whose emission doesn't favor its creators or early adopters.It should favor the late adopters.One such emission is the simplest one possible: one coin per second, forever.This is trivially implemented by having a fixed block reward (subsidy) equal to the block interval in seconds.Altruistic coins avoid wealth concentration and deter speculation, while encouraging use as a currency.After several decades of wide distribution, they have inflation rates comparable to fiat, but unlike fiat,this rate remains perfectly predictable and ever-decreasing.There should be more altruistic coins...It is going to be very difficult to change the definition of a word just like that, we must remember that this is a process, so for what you say to actually happen then we will need the majority of the altcoins in the future to be released with this feature, so the meaning of the word changes in the minds of the majority of the people, but will this ever happen? I do not think so, as we know the majority of those coins are released with only one intention behind them, and that is to make money for the developers of such coins.
